00049  * force QoS policy (not RR) to be used for testing purposes
00050  */
00051 #define FORCE_QOS_

00053 #define D_QOS   D_OTHER

00055 #define QOS_DEBUG(fmt, ...)     CDEBUG(D_QOS, fmt, ## __VA_ARGS__)
00056 #define QOS_CONSOLE(fmt, ...)   LCONSOLE(D_QOS, fmt, ## __VA_ARGS__)

00058 #define TGT_BAVAIL(i) (OST_TGT(lod,i)->ltd_statfs.os_bavail * \
00059                        OST_TGT(lod,i)->ltd_statfs.os_bsize)
00060 
00074 int qos_add_tgt(struct lod_device *lod, struct lod_tgt_desc *ost_desc)
00075 {
00076         struct lod_qos_oss *oss = NULL, *temposs;
00077         struct obd_export  *exp = ost_desc->ltd_exp;
00078         int                 rc = 0, found = 0;
00079         struct list_head   *list;
00080         ENTRY;
00081 
00082         down_write(&lod->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
00083         /*
00084          * a bit hacky approach to learn NID of corresponding connection
00085          * but there is no official API to access information like this
00086          * with OSD API.
00087          */
00088         list_for_each_entry(oss, &lod->lod_qos.lq_oss_list, lqo_oss_list) {
00089                 if (obd_uuid_equals(&oss->lqo_uuid,
00090                                     &exp->exp_connection->c_remote_uuid)) {
00091                         found++;
00092                         break;
00093                 }
00094         }
00095 
00096         if (!found) {
00097                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(oss);
00098                 if (!oss)
00099                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00100                 memcpy(&oss->lqo_uuid, &exp->exp_connection->c_remote_uuid,
00101                        sizeof(oss->lqo_uuid));
00102         } else {
00103                 /* Assume we have to move this one */
00104                 list_del(&oss->lqo_oss_list);
00105         }
00106 
00107         oss->lqo_ost_count++;
00108         ost_desc->ltd_qos.ltq_oss = oss;
00109 
00110         CDEBUG(D_QOS, "add tgt %s to OSS %s (%d OSTs)\n",
00111                obd_uuid2str(&ost_desc->ltd_uuid), obd_uuid2str(&oss->lqo_uuid),
00112                oss->lqo_ost_count);
00113 
00114         /* Add sorted by # of OSTs.  Find the first entry that we're
00115            bigger than... */
00116         list = &lod->lod_qos.lq_oss_list;
00117         list_for_each_entry(temposs, list, lqo_oss_list) {
00118                 if (oss->lqo_ost_count > temposs->lqo_ost_count)
00119                         break;
00120         }
00121         /* ...and add before it.  If we're the first or smallest, temposs
00122            points to the list head, and we add to the end. */
00123         list_add_tail(&oss->lqo_oss_list, &temposs->lqo_oss_list);
00124 
00125         lod->lod_qos.lq_dirty = 1;
00126         lod->lod_qos.lq_rr.lqr_dirty = 1;
00127 
00128 out:
00129         up_write(&lod->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
00130         RETURN(rc);
00131 }
00132 
00145 int qos_del_tgt(struct lod_device *lod, struct lod_tgt_desc *ost_desc)
00146 {
00147         struct lod_qos_oss *oss;
00148         int                 rc = 0;
00149         ENTRY;
00150 
00151         down_write(&lod->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
00152         oss = ost_desc->ltd_qos.ltq_oss;
00153         if (!oss)
00154                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
00155 
00156         oss->lqo_ost_count--;
00157         if (oss->lqo_ost_count == 0) {
00158                 CDEBUG(D_QOS, "removing OSS %s\n",
00159                        obd_uuid2str(&oss->lqo_uuid));
00160                 list_del(&oss->lqo_oss_list);
00161                 ost_desc->ltd_qos.ltq_oss = NULL;
00162                 OBD_FREE_PTR(oss);
00163         }
00164 
00165         lod->lod_qos.lq_dirty = 1;
00166         lod->lod_qos.lq_rr.lqr_dirty = 1;
00167 out:
00168         up_write(&lod->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
00169         RETURN(rc);
00170 }
00171 
00190 static int lod_statfs_and_check(const struct lu_env *env, struct lod_device *d,
00191                                 int index, struct obd_statfs *sfs)
00192 {
00193         struct lod_tgt_desc *ost;
00194         int                  rc;
00195         ENTRY;
00196 
00197         LASSERT(d);
00198         ost = OST_TGT(d,index);
00199         LASSERT(ost);
00200 
00201         rc = dt_statfs(env, ost->ltd_ost, sfs);
00202         if (rc && rc != -ENOTCONN)
00203                 CERROR("%s: statfs: rc = %d\n", lod2obd(d)->obd_name, rc);
00204 
00205         /* If the OST is readonly then we can't allocate objects there */
00206         if (sfs->os_state & OS_STATE_READONLY)
00207                 rc = -EROFS;
00208 
00209         /* check whether device has changed state (active, inactive) */
00210         if (rc != 0 && ost->ltd_active) {
00211                 /* turned inactive? */
00212                 spin_lock(&d->lod_desc_lock);
00213                 if (ost->ltd_active) {
00214                         ost->ltd_active = 0;
00215                         if (rc == -ENOTCONN)
00216                                 ost->ltd_connecting = 1;
00217 
00218                         LASSERT(d->lod_desc.ld_active_tgt_count > 0);
00219                         d->lod_desc.ld_active_tgt_count--;
00220                         d->lod_qos.lq_dirty = 1;
00221                         d->lod_qos.lq_rr.lqr_dirty = 1;
00222                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "%s: turns inactive\n",
00223                                ost->ltd_exp->exp_obd->obd_name);
00224                 }
00225                 spin_unlock(&d->lod_desc_lock);
00226         } else if (rc == 0 && ost->ltd_active == 0) {
00227                 /* turned active? */
00228                 LASSERTF(d->lod_desc.ld_active_tgt_count < d->lod_ostnr,
00229                          "active tgt count %d, ost nr %d\n",
00230                          d->lod_desc.ld_active_tgt_count, d->lod_ostnr);
00231                 spin_lock(&d->lod_desc_lock);
00232                 if (ost->ltd_active == 0) {
00233                         ost->ltd_active = 1;
00234                         ost->ltd_connecting = 0;
00235                         d->lod_desc.ld_active_tgt_count++;
00236                         d->lod_qos.lq_dirty = 1;
00237                         d->lod_qos.lq_rr.lqr_dirty = 1;
00238                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "%s: turns active\n",
00239                                ost->ltd_exp->exp_obd->obd_name);
00240                 }
00241                 spin_unlock(&d->lod_desc_lock);
00242         }
00243 
00244         RETURN(rc);
00245 }
00246 
00257 static void lod_qos_statfs_update(const struct lu_env *env,
00258                                   struct lod_device *lod)
00259 {
00260         struct obd_device *obd = lod2obd(lod);
00261         struct ost_pool   *osts = &(lod->lod_pool_info);
00262         unsigned int       i;
00263         int                idx;
00264         __u64              max_age, avail;
00265         ENTRY;
00266 
00267         max_age = cfs_time_shift_64(-2 * lod->lod_desc.ld_qos_maxage);
00268 
00269         if (cfs_time_beforeq_64(max_age, obd->obd_osfs_age))
00270                 /* statfs data are quite recent, don't need to refresh it */
00271                 RETURN_EXIT;
00272 
00273         down_write(&lod->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
00274         if (cfs_time_beforeq_64(max_age, obd->obd_osfs_age))
00275                 goto out;
00276 
00277         for (i = 0; i < osts->op_count; i++) {
00278                 idx = osts->op_array[i];
00279                 avail = OST_TGT(lod,idx)->ltd_statfs.os_bavail;
00280                 if (lod_statfs_and_check(env, lod, idx,
00281                                          &OST_TGT(lod, idx)->ltd_statfs))
00282                         continue;
00283                 if (OST_TGT(lod,idx)->ltd_statfs.os_bavail != avail)
00284                         /* recalculate weigths */
00285                         lod->lod_qos.lq_dirty = 1;
00286         }
00287         obd->obd_osfs_age = cfs_time_current_64();
00288 
00289 out:
00290         up_write(&lod->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
00291         EXIT;
00292 }
00293 
00310 static int lod_qos_calc_ppo(struct lod_device *lod)
00311 {
00312         struct lod_qos_oss *oss;
00313         __u64               ba_max, ba_min, temp;
00314         __u32               num_active;
00315         unsigned int        i;
00316         int                 rc, prio_wide;
00317         time_t              now, age;
00318         ENTRY;
00319 
00320         if (!lod->lod_qos.lq_dirty)
00321                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00322 
00323         num_active = lod->lod_desc.ld_active_tgt_count - 1;
00324         if (num_active < 1)
00325                 GOTO(out, rc = -EAGAIN);
00326 
00327         /* find bavail on each OSS */
00328         list_for_each_entry(oss, &lod->lod_qos.lq_oss_list, lqo_oss_list)
00329                             oss->lqo_bavail = 0;
00330         lod->lod_qos.lq_active_oss_count = 0;
00331 
00332         /*
00333          * How badly user wants to select OSTs "widely" (not recently chosen
00334          * and not on recent OSS's).  As opposed to "freely" (free space
00335          * avail.) 0-256
00336          */
00337         prio_wide = 256 - lod->lod_qos.lq_prio_free;
00338 
00339         ba_min = (__u64)(-1);
00340         ba_max = 0;
00341         now = cfs_time_current_sec();
00342         /* Calculate OST penalty per object
00343          * (lod ref taken in lod_qos_prep_create()) */
00344         cfs_foreach_bit(lod->lod_ost_bitmap, i) {
00345                 LASSERT(OST_TGT(lod,i));
00346                 temp = TGT_BAVAIL(i);
00347                 if (!temp)
00348                         continue;
00349                 ba_min = min(temp, ba_min);
00350                 ba_max = max(temp, ba_max);
00351 
00352                 /* Count the number of usable OSS's */
00353                 if (OST_TGT(lod,i)->ltd_qos.ltq_oss->lqo_bavail == 0)
00354                         lod->lod_qos.lq_active_oss_count++;
00355                 OST_TGT(lod,i)->ltd_qos.ltq_oss->lqo_bavail += temp;
00356 
00357                 /* per-OST penalty is prio * TGT_bavail / (num_ost - 1) / 2 */
00358                 temp >>= 1;
00359                 do_div(temp, num_active);
00360                 OST_TGT(lod,i)->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty_per_obj =
00361                         (temp * prio_wide) >> 8;
00362 
00363                 age = (now - OST_TGT(lod,i)->ltd_qos.ltq_used) >> 3;
00364                 if (lod->lod_qos.lq_reset ||
00365                     age > 32 * lod->lod_desc.ld_qos_maxage)
00366                         OST_TGT(lod,i)->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty = 0;
00367                 else if (age > lod->lod_desc.ld_qos_maxage)
00368                         /* Decay OST penalty. */
00369                         OST_TGT(lod,i)->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty >>=
00370                                 (age / lod->lod_desc.ld_qos_maxage);
00371         }
00372 
00373         num_active = lod->lod_qos.lq_active_oss_count - 1;
00374         if (num_active < 1) {
00375                 /* If there's only 1 OSS, we can't penalize it, so instead
00376                    we have to double the OST penalty */
00377                 num_active = 1;
00378                 cfs_foreach_bit(lod->lod_ost_bitmap, i)
00379                         OST_TGT(lod,i)->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty_per_obj <<= 1;
00380         }
00381 
00382         /* Per-OSS penalty is prio * oss_avail / oss_osts / (num_oss - 1) / 2 */
00383         list_for_each_entry(oss, &lod->lod_qos.lq_oss_list, lqo_oss_list) {
00384                 temp = oss->lqo_bavail >> 1;
00385                 do_div(temp, oss->lqo_ost_count * num_active);
00386                 oss->lqo_penalty_per_obj = (temp * prio_wide) >> 8;
00387 
00388                 age = (now - oss->lqo_used) >> 3;
00389                 if (lod->lod_qos.lq_reset ||
00390                     age > 32 * lod->lod_desc.ld_qos_maxage)
00391                         oss->lqo_penalty = 0;
00392                 else if (age > lod->lod_desc.ld_qos_maxage)
00393                         /* Decay OSS penalty. */
00394                         oss->lqo_penalty >>= age / lod->lod_desc.ld_qos_maxage;
00395         }
00396 
00397         lod->lod_qos.lq_dirty = 0;
00398         lod->lod_qos.lq_reset = 0;
00399 
00400         /* If each ost has almost same free space,
00401          * do rr allocation for better creation performance */
00402         lod->lod_qos.lq_same_space = 0;
00403         if ((ba_max * (256 - lod->lod_qos.lq_threshold_rr)) >> 8 < ba_min) {
00404                 lod->lod_qos.lq_same_space = 1;
00405                 /* Reset weights for the next time we enter qos mode */
00406                 lod->lod_qos.lq_reset = 1;
00407         }
00408         rc = 0;
00409 
00410 out:
00411 #ifndef FORCE_QOS
00412         if (!rc && lod->lod_qos.lq_same_space)
00413                 RETURN(-EAGAIN);
00414 #endif
00415         RETURN(rc);
00416 }
00417 
00429 static int lod_qos_calc_weight(struct lod_device *lod, int i)
00430 {
00431         __u64 temp, temp2;
00432 
00433         temp = TGT_BAVAIL(i);
00434         temp2 = OST_TGT(lod,i)->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty +
00435                 OST_TGT(lod,i)->ltd_qos.ltq_oss->lqo_penalty;
00436         if (temp < temp2)
00437                 OST_TGT(lod,i)->ltd_qos.ltq_weight = 0;
00438         else
00439                 OST_TGT(lod,i)->ltd_qos.ltq_weight = temp - temp2;
00440         return 0;
00441 }
00442 
00457 static int lod_qos_used(struct lod_device *lod, struct ost_pool *osts,
00458                         __u32 index, __u64 *total_wt)
00459 {
00460         struct lod_tgt_desc *ost;
00461         struct lod_qos_oss  *oss;
00462         unsigned int j;
00463         ENTRY;
00464 
00465         ost = OST_TGT(lod,index);
00466         LASSERT(ost);
00467 
00468         /* Don't allocate on this devuce anymore, until the next alloc_qos */
00469         ost->ltd_qos.ltq_usable = 0;
00470 
00471         oss = ost->ltd_qos.ltq_oss;
00472 
00473         /* Decay old penalty by half (we're adding max penalty, and don't
00474            want it to run away.) */
00475         ost->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty >>= 1;
00476         oss->lqo_penalty >>= 1;
00477 
00478         /* mark the OSS and OST as recently used */
00479         ost->ltd_qos.ltq_used = oss->lqo_used = cfs_time_current_sec();
00480 
00481         /* Set max penalties for this OST and OSS */
00482         ost->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty +=
00483                 ost->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty_per_obj * lod->lod_ostnr;
00484         oss->lqo_penalty += oss->lqo_penalty_per_obj *
00485                 lod->lod_qos.lq_active_oss_count;
00486 
00487         /* Decrease all OSS penalties */
00488         list_for_each_entry(oss, &lod->lod_qos.lq_oss_list, lqo_oss_list) {
00489                 if (oss->lqo_penalty < oss->lqo_penalty_per_obj)
00490                         oss->lqo_penalty = 0;
00491                 else
00492                         oss->lqo_penalty -= oss->lqo_penalty_per_obj;
00493         }
00494 
00495         *total_wt = 0;
00496         /* Decrease all OST penalties */
00497         for (j = 0; j < osts->op_count; j++) {
00498                 int i;
00499 
00500                 i = osts->op_array[j];
00501                 if (!cfs_bitmap_check(lod->lod_ost_bitmap, i))
00502                         continue;
00503 
00504                 ost = OST_TGT(lod,i);
00505                 LASSERT(ost);
00506 
00507                 if (ost->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty <
00508                                 ost->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty_per_obj)
00509                         ost->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty = 0;
00510                 else
00511                         ost->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty -=
00512                                 ost->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty_per_obj;
00513 
00514                 lod_qos_calc_weight(lod, i);
00515 
00516                 /* Recalc the total weight of usable osts */
00517                 if (ost->ltd_qos.ltq_usable)
00518                         *total_wt += ost->ltd_qos.ltq_weight;
00519 
00520                 QOS_DEBUG("recalc tgt %d usable=%d avail="LPU64
00521                           " ostppo="LPU64" ostp="LPU64" ossppo="LPU64
00522                           " ossp="LPU64" wt="LPU64"\n",
00523                           i, ost->ltd_qos.ltq_usable, TGT_BAVAIL(i) >> 10,
00524                           ost->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty_per_obj >> 10,
00525                           ost->ltd_qos.ltq_penalty >> 10,
00526                           ost->ltd_qos.ltq_oss->lqo_penalty_per_obj >> 10,
00527                           ost->ltd_qos.ltq_oss->lqo_penalty >> 10,
00528                           ost->ltd_qos.ltq_weight >> 10);
00529         }
00530 
00531         RETURN(0);
00532 }
00533 
00534 void lod_qos_rr_init(struct lod_qos_rr *lqr)
00535 {
00536         spin_lock_init(&lqr->lqr_alloc);
00537         lqr->lqr_dirty = 1;
00538 }
00539 
00540 
00541 #define LOV_QOS_EMPTY ((__u32)-1)
00542 
00559 static int lod_qos_calc_rr(struct lod_device *lod, struct ost_pool *src_pool,
00560                            struct lod_qos_rr *lqr)
00561 {
00562         struct lod_qos_oss  *oss;
00563         struct lod_tgt_desc *ost;
00564         unsigned placed, real_count;
00565         unsigned int i;
00566         int rc;
00567         ENTRY;
00568 
00569         if (!lqr->lqr_dirty) {
00570                 LASSERT(lqr->lqr_pool.op_size);
00571                 RETURN(0);
00572         }
00573 
00574         /* Do actual allocation. */
00575         down_write(&lod->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
00576 
00577         /*
00578          * Check again. While we were sleeping on @lq_rw_sem something could
00579          * change.
00580          */
00581         if (!lqr->lqr_dirty) {
00582                 LASSERT(lqr->lqr_pool.op_size);
00583                 up_write(&lod->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
00584                 RETURN(0);
00585         }
00586 
00587         real_count = src_pool->op_count;
00588 
00589         /* Zero the pool array */
00590         /* alloc_rr is holding a read lock on the pool, so nobody is adding/
00591            deleting from the pool. The lq_rw_sem insures that nobody else
00592            is reading. */
00593         lqr->lqr_pool.op_count = real_count;
00594         rc = lod_ost_pool_extend(&lqr->lqr_pool, real_count);
00595         if (rc) {
00596                 up_write(&lod->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
00597                 RETURN(rc);
00598         }
00599         for (i = 0; i < lqr->lqr_pool.op_count; i++)
00600                 lqr->lqr_pool.op_array[i] = LOV_QOS_EMPTY;
00601 
00602         /* Place all the OSTs from 1 OSS at the same time. */
00603         placed = 0;
00604         list_for_each_entry(oss, &lod->lod_qos.lq_oss_list, lqo_oss_list) {
00605                 int j = 0;
00606 
00607                 for (i = 0; i < lqr->lqr_pool.op_count; i++) {
00608                         int next;
00609 
00610                         if (!cfs_bitmap_check(lod->lod_ost_bitmap,
00611                                                 src_pool->op_array[i]))
00612                                 continue;
00613 
00614                         ost = OST_TGT(lod,src_pool->op_array[i]);
00615                         LASSERT(ost && ost->ltd_ost);
00616                         if (ost->ltd_qos.ltq_oss != oss)
00617                                 continue;
00618 
00619                         /* Evenly space these OSTs across arrayspace */
00620                         next = j * lqr->lqr_pool.op_count / oss->lqo_ost_count;
00621                         while (lqr->lqr_pool.op_array[next] != LOV_QOS_EMPTY)
00622                                 next = (next + 1) % lqr->lqr_pool.op_count;
00623 
00624                         lqr->lqr_pool.op_array[next] = src_pool->op_array[i];
00625                         j++;
00626                         placed++;
00627                 }
00628         }
00629 
00630         lqr->lqr_dirty = 0;
00631         up_write(&lod->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
00632 
00633         if (placed != real_count) {
00634                 /* This should never happen */
00635                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x14e, "Failed to place all OSTs in the "
00636                                    "round-robin list (%d of %d).\n",
00637                                    placed, real_count);
00638                 for (i = 0; i < lqr->lqr_pool.op_count; i++) {
00639                         LCONSOLE(D_WARNING, "rr #%d ost idx=%d\n", i,
00640                                  lqr->lqr_pool.op_array[i]);
00641                 }
00642                 lqr->lqr_dirty = 1;
00643                 RETURN(-EAGAIN);
00644         }
00645 
00646 #if 0
00647         for (i = 0; i < lqr->lqr_pool.op_count; i++)
00648                 QOS_CONSOLE("rr #%d ost idx=%d\n", i, lqr->lqr_pool.op_array[i]);
00649 #endif
00650 
00651         RETURN(0);
00652 }
00653 
00674 static struct dt_object *lod_qos_declare_object_on(const struct lu_env *env,
00675                                                    struct lod_device *d,
00676                                                    __u32 ost_idx,
00677                                                    struct thandle *th)
00678 {
00679         struct lod_tgt_desc *ost;
00680         struct lu_object *o, *n;
00681         struct lu_device *nd;
00682         struct dt_object *dt;
00683         int               rc;
00684         ENTRY;
00685 
00686         LASSERT(d);
00687         LASSERT(ost_idx < d->lod_osts_size);
00688         ost = OST_TGT(d,ost_idx);
00689         LASSERT(ost);
00690         LASSERT(ost->ltd_ost);
00691 
00692         nd = &ost->ltd_ost->dd_lu_dev;
00693 
00694         /*
00695          * allocate anonymous object with zero fid, real fid
00696          * will be assigned by OSP within transaction
00697          * XXX: to be fixed with fully-functional OST fids
00698          */
00699         o = lu_object_anon(env, nd, NULL);
00700         if (IS_ERR(o))
00701                 GOTO(out, dt = ERR_PTR(PTR_ERR(o)));
00702 
00703         n = lu_object_locate(o->lo_header, nd->ld_type);
00704         if (unlikely(n == NULL)) {
00705                 CERROR("can't find slice\n");
00706                 lu_object_put(env, o);
00707                 GOTO(out, dt = ERR_PTR(-EINVAL));
00708         }
00709 
00710         dt = container_of(n, struct dt_object, do_lu);
00711 
00712         rc = lod_sub_object_declare_create(env, dt, NULL, NULL, NULL, th);
00713         if (rc < 0) {
00714                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "can't declare creation on #%u: %d\n",
00715                        ost_idx, rc);
00716                 lu_object_put(env, o);
00717                 dt = ERR_PTR(rc);
00718         }
00719 
00720 out:
00721         RETURN(dt);
00722 }
00723 
00735 static int min_stripe_count(__u32 stripe_cnt, int flags)
00736 {
00737         return (flags & LOV_USES_DEFAULT_STRIPE ?
00738                         stripe_cnt - (stripe_cnt / 4) : stripe_cnt);
00739 }
00740 
00741 #define LOV_CREATE_RESEED_MULT 30
00742 #define LOV_CREATE_RESEED_MIN  2000
00743 
00755 static int inline lod_qos_dev_is_full(struct obd_statfs *msfs)
00756 {
00757         __u64 used;
00758         int   bs = msfs->os_bsize;
00759 
00760         LASSERT(((bs - 1) & bs) == 0);
00761 
00762         /* the minimum of 0.1% used blocks and 1GB bytes. */
00763         used = min_t(__u64, (msfs->os_blocks - msfs->os_bfree) >> 10,
00764                         1 << (31 - ffs(bs)));
00765         return (msfs->os_bavail < used);
00766 }
00767 
00780 static inline int lod_qos_ost_in_use_clear(const struct lu_env *env,
00781                                            __u32 stripes)
00782 {
00783         struct lod_thread_info *info = lod_env_info(env);
00784 
00785         if (info->lti_ea_store_size < sizeof(int) * stripes)
00786                 lod_ea_store_resize(info, stripes * sizeof(int));
00787         if (info->lti_ea_store_size < sizeof(int) * stripes) {
00788                 CERROR("can't allocate memory for ost-in-use array\n");
00789                 return -ENOMEM;
00790         }
00791         memset(info->lti_ea_store, -1, sizeof(int) * stripes);
00792         return 0;
00793 }
00794 
00805 static inline void lod_qos_ost_in_use(const struct lu_env *env,
00806                                       int idx, int ost)
00807 {
00808         struct lod_thread_info *info = lod_env_info(env);
00809         int *osts = info->lti_ea_store;
00810 
00811         LASSERT(info->lti_ea_store_size >= idx * sizeof(int));
00812         osts[idx] = ost;
00813 }
00814 
00828 static int lod_qos_is_ost_used(const struct lu_env *env, int ost, __u32 stripes)
00829 {
00830         struct lod_thread_info *info = lod_env_info(env);
00831         int *osts = info->lti_ea_store;
00832         __u32 j;
00833 
00834         for (j = 0; j < stripes; j++) {
00835                 if (osts[j] == ost)
00836                         return 1;
00837         }
00838         return 0;
00839 }
00840 
00841 static int lod_check_and_reserve_ost(const struct lu_env *env,
00842                                      struct lod_device *m,
00843                                      struct obd_statfs *sfs, __u32 ost_idx,
00844                                      __u32 speed, __u32 *s_idx,
00845                                      struct dt_object **stripe,
00846                                      struct thandle *th)
00847 {
00848         struct dt_object   *o;
00849         __u32 stripe_idx = *s_idx;
00850         int rc;
00851 
00852         rc = lod_statfs_and_check(env, m, ost_idx, sfs);
00853         if (rc) {
00854                 /* this OSP doesn't feel well */
00855                 goto out_return;
00856         }
00857 
00858         /*
00859          * skip full devices
00860          */
00861         if (lod_qos_dev_is_full(sfs)) {
00862                 QOS_DEBUG("#%d is full\n", ost_idx);
00863                 goto out_return;
00864         }
00865 
00866         /*
00867          * We expect number of precreated objects in f_ffree at
00868          * the first iteration, skip OSPs with no objects ready
00869          */
00870         if (sfs->os_fprecreated == 0 && speed == 0) {
00871                 QOS_DEBUG("#%d: precreation is empty\n", ost_idx);
00872                 goto out_return;
00873         }
00874 
00875         /*
00876          * try to use another OSP if this one is degraded
00877          */
00878         if (sfs->os_state & OS_STATE_DEGRADED && speed < 2) {
00879                 QOS_DEBUG("#%d: degraded\n", ost_idx);
00880                 goto out_return;
00881         }
00882 
00883         /*
00884          * do not put >1 objects on a single OST
00885          */
00886         if (speed && lod_qos_is_ost_used(env, ost_idx, stripe_idx))
00887                 goto out_return;
00888 
00889         o = lod_qos_declare_object_on(env, m, ost_idx, th);
00890         if (IS_ERR(o)) {
00891                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "can't declare new object on #%u: %d\n",
00892                        ost_idx, (int) PTR_ERR(o));
00893                 rc = PTR_ERR(o);
00894                 goto out_return;
00895         }
00896 
00897         /*
00898          * We've successfully declared (reserved) an object
00899          */
00900         lod_qos_ost_in_use(env, stripe_idx, ost_idx);
00901         stripe[stripe_idx] = o;
00902         stripe_idx++;
00903         *s_idx = stripe_idx;
00904 
00905 out_return:
00906         return rc;
00907 }
00908 
00933 static int lod_alloc_rr(const struct lu_env *env, struct lod_object *lo,
00934                         struct dt_object **stripe, int flags,
00935                         struct thandle *th)
00936 {
00937         struct lod_device *m = lu2lod_dev(lo->ldo_obj.do_lu.lo_dev);
00938         struct obd_statfs *sfs = &lod_env_info(env)->lti_osfs;
00939         struct pool_desc  *pool = NULL;
00940         struct ost_pool   *osts;
00941         struct lod_qos_rr *lqr;
00942         unsigned int       i, array_idx;
00943         int                rc;
00944         __u32              ost_start_idx_temp;
00945         int                speed = 0;
00946         int                ost_connecting = 0;
00947         __u32              stripe_idx = 0;
00948         __u32              stripe_cnt = lo->ldo_stripenr;
00949         __u32              stripe_cnt_min = min_stripe_count(stripe_cnt, flags);
00950         __u32              ost_idx;
00951         ENTRY;
00952 
00953         if (lo->ldo_pool)
00954                 pool = lod_find_pool(m, lo->ldo_pool);
00955 
00956         if (pool != NULL) {
00957                 down_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(pool));
00958                 osts = &(pool->pool_obds);
00959                 lqr = &(pool->pool_rr);
00960         } else {
00961                 osts = &(m->lod_pool_info);
00962                 lqr = &(m->lod_qos.lq_rr);
00963         }
00964 
00965         rc = lod_qos_calc_rr(m, osts, lqr);
00966         if (rc)
00967                 GOTO(out, rc);
00968 
00969         rc = lod_qos_ost_in_use_clear(env, lo->ldo_stripenr);
00970         if (rc)
00971                 GOTO(out, rc);
00972 
00973         down_read(&m->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
00974         spin_lock(&lqr->lqr_alloc);
00975         if (--lqr->lqr_start_count <= 0) {
00976                 lqr->lqr_start_idx = cfs_rand() % osts->op_count;
00977                 lqr->lqr_start_count =
00978                         (LOV_CREATE_RESEED_MIN / max(osts->op_count, 1U) +
00979                          LOV_CREATE_RESEED_MULT) * max(osts->op_count, 1U);
00980         } else if (stripe_cnt_min >= osts->op_count ||
00981                         lqr->lqr_start_idx > osts->op_count) {
00982                 /* If we have allocated from all of the OSTs, slowly
00983                  * precess the next start if the OST/stripe count isn't
00984                  * already doing this for us. */
00985                 lqr->lqr_start_idx %= osts->op_count;
00986                 if (stripe_cnt > 1 && (osts->op_count % stripe_cnt) != 1)
00987                         ++lqr->lqr_offset_idx;
00988         }
00989         ost_start_idx_temp = lqr->lqr_start_idx;
00990 
00991 repeat_find:
00992 
00993         QOS_DEBUG("pool '%s' want %d startidx %d startcnt %d offset %d "
00994                   "active %d count %d\n",
00995                   lo->ldo_pool ? lo->ldo_pool : "",
00996                   stripe_cnt, lqr->lqr_start_idx, lqr->lqr_start_count,
00997                   lqr->lqr_offset_idx, osts->op_count, osts->op_count);
00998 
00999         for (i = 0; i < osts->op_count && stripe_idx < lo->ldo_stripenr; i++) {
01000                 array_idx = (lqr->lqr_start_idx + lqr->lqr_offset_idx) %
01001                                 osts->op_count;
01002                 ++lqr->lqr_start_idx;
01003                 ost_idx = lqr->lqr_pool.op_array[array_idx];
01004 
01005                 QOS_DEBUG("#%d strt %d act %d strp %d ary %d idx %d\n",
01006                           i, lqr->lqr_start_idx, /* XXX: active*/ 0,
01007                           stripe_idx, array_idx, ost_idx);
01008 
01009                 if ((ost_idx == LOV_QOS_EMPTY) ||
01010                     !cfs_bitmap_check(m->lod_ost_bitmap, ost_idx))
01011                         continue;
01012 
01013                 /* Fail Check before osc_precreate() is called
01014                    so we can only 'fail' single OSC. */
01015                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_MDS_OSC_PRECREATE) && ost_idx == 0)
01016                         continue;
01017 
01018                 spin_unlock(&lqr->lqr_alloc);
01019                 rc = lod_check_and_reserve_ost(env, m, sfs, ost_idx, speed,
01020                                                &stripe_idx, stripe, th);
01021                 spin_lock(&lqr->lqr_alloc);
01022 
01023                 if (rc != 0 && OST_TGT(m, ost_idx)->ltd_connecting)
01024                         ost_connecting = 1;
01025         }
01026         if ((speed < 2) && (stripe_idx < stripe_cnt_min)) {
01027                 /* Try again, allowing slower OSCs */
01028                 speed++;
01029                 lqr->lqr_start_idx = ost_start_idx_temp;
01030 
01031                 ost_connecting = 0;
01032                 goto repeat_find;
01033         }
01034 
01035         spin_unlock(&lqr->lqr_alloc);
01036         up_read(&m->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
01037 
01038         if (stripe_idx) {
01039                 lo->ldo_stripenr = stripe_idx;
01040                 /* at least one stripe is allocated */
01041                 rc = 0;
01042         } else {
01043                 /* nobody provided us with a single object */
01044                 if (ost_connecting)
01045                         rc = -EINPROGRESS;
01046                 else
01047                         rc = -ENOSPC;
01048         }
01049 
01050 out:
01051         if (pool != NULL) {
01052                 up_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(pool));
01053                 /* put back ref got by lod_find_pool() */
01054                 lod_pool_putref(pool);
01055         }
01056 
01057         RETURN(rc);
01058 }
01059 
01084 static int lod_alloc_ost_list(const struct lu_env *env,
01085                               struct lod_object *lo, struct dt_object **stripe,
01086                               struct lov_user_md *lum, struct thandle *th)
01087 {
01088         struct lod_device       *m = lu2lod_dev(lo->ldo_obj.do_lu.lo_dev);
01089         struct obd_statfs       *sfs = &lod_env_info(env)->lti_osfs;
01090         struct dt_object        *o;
01091         struct lov_user_md_v3   *v3;
01092         unsigned int            array_idx = 0;
01093         int                     stripe_count = 0;
01094         int                     i;
01095         int                     rc;
01096         ENTRY;
01097 
01098         /* for specific OSTs layout */
01099         LASSERT(lum != NULL && lum->lmm_magic == LOV_USER_MAGIC_SPECIFIC);
01100         lustre_print_user_md(D_OTHER, lum, __func__);
01101 
01102         rc = lod_qos_ost_in_use_clear(env, lo->ldo_stripenr);
01103         if (rc < 0)
01104                 RETURN(rc);
01105 
01106         v3 = (struct lov_user_md_v3 *)lum;
01107         for (i = 0; i < lo->ldo_stripenr; i++) {
01108                 if (v3->lmm_objects[i].l_ost_idx == lo->ldo_def_stripe_offset) {
01109                         array_idx = i;
01110                         break;
01111                 }
01112         }
01113         if (i == lo->ldo_stripenr) {
01114                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER,
01115                        "%s: start index %d not in the specified list of OSTs\n",
01116                        lod2obd(m)->obd_name, lo->ldo_def_stripe_offset);
01117                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01118         }
01119 
01120         for (i = 0; i < lo->ldo_stripenr;
01121              i++, array_idx = (array_idx + 1) % lo->ldo_stripenr) {
01122                 __u32 ost_idx = v3->lmm_objects[array_idx].l_ost_idx;
01123 
01124                 if (!cfs_bitmap_check(m->lod_ost_bitmap, ost_idx)) {
01125                         rc = -ENODEV;
01126                         break;
01127                 }
01128 
01129                 /*
01130                  * do not put >1 objects on a single OST
01131                  */
01132                 if (lod_qos_is_ost_used(env, ost_idx, stripe_count)) {
01133                         rc = -EINVAL;
01134                         break;
01135                 }
01136 
01137                 rc = lod_statfs_and_check(env, m, ost_idx, sfs);
01138                 if (rc < 0) /* this OSP doesn't feel well */
01139                         break;
01140 
01141                 o = lod_qos_declare_object_on(env, m, ost_idx, th);
01142                 if (IS_ERR(o)) {
01143                         rc = PTR_ERR(o);
01144                         CDEBUG(D_OTHER,
01145                                "%s: can't declare new object on #%u: %d\n",
01146                                lod2obd(m)->obd_name, ost_idx, rc);
01147                         break;
01148                 }
01149 
01150                 /*
01151                  * We've successfully declared (reserved) an object
01152                  */
01153                 lod_qos_ost_in_use(env, stripe_count, ost_idx);
01154                 stripe[stripe_count] = o;
01155                 stripe_count++;
01156         }
01157 
01158         RETURN(rc);
01159 }
01160 
01185 static int lod_alloc_specific(const struct lu_env *env, struct lod_object *lo,
01186                               struct dt_object **stripe, int flags,
01187                               struct thandle *th)
01188 {
01189         struct lod_device *m = lu2lod_dev(lo->ldo_obj.do_lu.lo_dev);
01190         struct obd_statfs *sfs = &lod_env_info(env)->lti_osfs;
01191         struct dt_object  *o;
01192         __u32              ost_idx;
01193         unsigned int       i, array_idx, ost_count;
01194         int                rc, stripe_num = 0;
01195         int                speed = 0;
01196         struct pool_desc  *pool = NULL;
01197         struct ost_pool   *osts;
01198         ENTRY;
01199 
01200         rc = lod_qos_ost_in_use_clear(env, lo->ldo_stripenr);
01201         if (rc)
01202                 GOTO(out, rc);
01203 
01204         if (lo->ldo_pool)
01205                 pool = lod_find_pool(m, lo->ldo_pool);
01206 
01207         if (pool != NULL) {
01208                 down_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(pool));
01209                 osts = &(pool->pool_obds);
01210         } else {
01211                 osts = &(m->lod_pool_info);
01212         }
01213 
01214         ost_count = osts->op_count;
01215 
01216 repeat_find:
01217         /* search loi_ost_idx in ost array */
01218         array_idx = 0;
01219         for (i = 0; i < ost_count; i++) {
01220                 if (osts->op_array[i] == lo->ldo_def_stripe_offset) {
01221                         array_idx = i;
01222                         break;
01223                 }
01224         }
01225         if (i == ost_count) {
01226                 CERROR("Start index %d not found in pool '%s'\n",
01227                        lo->ldo_def_stripe_offset,
01228                        lo->ldo_pool ? lo->ldo_pool : "");
01229                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01230         }
01231 
01232         for (i = 0; i < ost_count;
01233                         i++, array_idx = (array_idx + 1) % ost_count) {
01234                 ost_idx = osts->op_array[array_idx];
01235 
01236                 if (!cfs_bitmap_check(m->lod_ost_bitmap, ost_idx))
01237                         continue;
01238 
01239                 /* Fail Check before osc_precreate() is called
01240                    so we can only 'fail' single OSC. */
01241                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_MDS_OSC_PRECREATE) && ost_idx == 0)
01242                         continue;
01243 
01244                 /*
01245                  * do not put >1 objects on a single OST
01246                  */
01247                 if (lod_qos_is_ost_used(env, ost_idx, stripe_num))
01248                         continue;
01249 
01250                 /* Drop slow OSCs if we can, but not for requested start idx.
01251                  *
01252                  * This means "if OSC is slow and it is not the requested
01253                  * start OST, then it can be skipped, otherwise skip it only
01254                  * if it is inactive/recovering/out-of-space." */
01255 
01256                 rc = lod_statfs_and_check(env, m, ost_idx, sfs);
01257                 if (rc) {
01258                         /* this OSP doesn't feel well */
01259                         continue;
01260                 }
01261 
01262                 /*
01263                  * We expect number of precreated objects in f_ffree at
01264                  * the first iteration, skip OSPs with no objects ready
01265                  * don't apply this logic to OST specified with stripe_offset
01266                  */
01267                 if (i != 0 && sfs->os_fprecreated == 0 && speed == 0)
01268                         continue;
01269 
01270                 o = lod_qos_declare_object_on(env, m, ost_idx, th);
01271                 if (IS_ERR(o)) {
01272                         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "can't declare new object on #%u: %d\n",
01273                                ost_idx, (int) PTR_ERR(o));
01274                         continue;
01275                 }
01276 
01277                 /*
01278                  * We've successfully declared (reserved) an object
01279                  */
01280                 lod_qos_ost_in_use(env, stripe_num, ost_idx);
01281                 stripe[stripe_num] = o;
01282                 stripe_num++;
01283 
01284                 /* We have enough stripes */
01285                 if (stripe_num == lo->ldo_stripenr)
01286                         GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01287         }
01288         if (speed < 2) {
01289                 /* Try again, allowing slower OSCs */
01290                 speed++;
01291                 goto repeat_find;
01292         }
01293 
01294         /* If we were passed specific striping params, then a failure to
01295          * meet those requirements is an error, since we can't reallocate
01296          * that memory (it might be part of a larger array or something).
01297          */
01298         CERROR("can't lstripe objid "DFID": have %d want %u\n",
01299                PFID(lu_object_fid(lod2lu_obj(lo))), stripe_num,
01300                lo->ldo_stripenr);
01301         rc = stripe_num == 0 ? -ENOSPC : -EFBIG;
01302 out:
01303         if (pool != NULL) {
01304                 up_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(pool));
01305                 /* put back ref got by lod_find_pool() */
01306                 lod_pool_putref(pool);
01307         }
01308 
01309         RETURN(rc);
01310 }
01311 
01325 static inline int lod_qos_is_usable(struct lod_device *lod)
01326 {
01327 #ifdef FORCE_QOS
01328         /* to be able to debug QoS code */
01329         return 1;
01330 #endif
01331 
01332         /* Detect -EAGAIN early, before expensive lock is taken. */
01333         if (!lod->lod_qos.lq_dirty && lod->lod_qos.lq_same_space)
01334                 return 0;
01335 
01336         if (lod->lod_desc.ld_active_tgt_count < 2)
01337                 return 0;
01338 
01339         return 1;
01340 }
01341 
01375 static int lod_alloc_qos(const struct lu_env *env, struct lod_object *lo,
01376                          struct dt_object **stripe, int flags,
01377                          struct thandle *th)
01378 {
01379         struct lod_device   *m = lu2lod_dev(lo->ldo_obj.do_lu.lo_dev);
01380         struct obd_statfs   *sfs = &lod_env_info(env)->lti_osfs;
01381         struct lod_tgt_desc *ost;
01382         struct dt_object    *o;
01383         __u64                total_weight = 0;
01384         unsigned int         i;
01385         int                  rc = 0;
01386         __u32                nfound, good_osts;
01387         __u32                stripe_cnt = lo->ldo_stripenr;
01388         __u32                stripe_cnt_min;
01389         struct pool_desc    *pool = NULL;
01390         struct ost_pool    *osts;
01391         ENTRY;
01392 
01393         stripe_cnt_min = min_stripe_count(stripe_cnt, flags);
01394         if (stripe_cnt_min < 1)
01395                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01396 
01397         if (lo->ldo_pool)
01398                 pool = lod_find_pool(m, lo->ldo_pool);
01399 
01400         if (pool != NULL) {
01401                 down_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(pool));
01402                 osts = &(pool->pool_obds);
01403         } else {
01404                 osts = &(m->lod_pool_info);
01405         }
01406 
01407         /* Detect -EAGAIN early, before expensive lock is taken. */
01408         if (!lod_qos_is_usable(m))
01409                 GOTO(out_nolock, rc = -EAGAIN);
01410 
01411         /* Do actual allocation, use write lock here. */
01412         down_write(&m->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
01413 
01414         /*
01415          * Check again, while we were sleeping on @lq_rw_sem things could
01416          * change.
01417          */
01418         if (!lod_qos_is_usable(m))
01419                 GOTO(out, rc = -EAGAIN);
01420 
01421         rc = lod_qos_calc_ppo(m);
01422         if (rc)
01423                 GOTO(out, rc);
01424 
01425         rc = lod_qos_ost_in_use_clear(env, lo->ldo_stripenr);
01426         if (rc)
01427                 GOTO(out, rc);
01428 
01429         good_osts = 0;
01430         /* Find all the OSTs that are valid stripe candidates */
01431         for (i = 0; i < osts->op_count; i++) {
01432                 if (!cfs_bitmap_check(m->lod_ost_bitmap, osts->op_array[i]))
01433                         continue;
01434 
01435                 rc = lod_statfs_and_check(env, m, osts->op_array[i], sfs);
01436                 if (rc) {
01437                         /* this OSP doesn't feel well */
01438                         continue;
01439                 }
01440 
01441                 /*
01442                  * skip full devices
01443                  */
01444                 if (lod_qos_dev_is_full(sfs))
01445                         continue;
01446 
01447                 /* Fail Check before osc_precreate() is called
01448                    so we can only 'fail' single OSC. */
01449                 if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_MDS_OSC_PRECREATE) &&
01450                                    osts->op_array[i] == 0)
01451                         continue;
01452 
01453                 ost = OST_TGT(m,osts->op_array[i]);
01454                 ost->ltd_qos.ltq_usable = 1;
01455                 lod_qos_calc_weight(m, osts->op_array[i]);
01456                 total_weight += ost->ltd_qos.ltq_weight;
01457 
01458                 good_osts++;
01459         }
01460 
01461         QOS_DEBUG("found %d good osts\n", good_osts);
01462 
01463         if (good_osts < stripe_cnt_min)
01464                 GOTO(out, rc = -EAGAIN);
01465 
01466         /* We have enough osts */
01467         if (good_osts < stripe_cnt)
01468                 stripe_cnt = good_osts;
01469 
01470         /* Find enough OSTs with weighted random allocation. */
01471         nfound = 0;
01472         while (nfound < stripe_cnt) {
01473                 __u64 rand, cur_weight;
01474 
01475                 cur_weight = 0;
01476                 rc = -ENOSPC;
01477 
01478                 if (total_weight) {
01479 #if BITS_PER_LONG == 32
01480                         rand = cfs_rand() % (unsigned)total_weight;
01481                         /* If total_weight > 32-bit, first generate the high
01482                          * 32 bits of the random number, then add in the low
01483                          * 32 bits (truncated to the upper limit, if needed) */
01484                         if (total_weight > 0xffffffffULL)
01485                                 rand = (__u64)(cfs_rand() %
01486                                         (unsigned)(total_weight >> 32)) << 32;
01487                         else
01488                                 rand = 0;
01489 
01490                         if (rand == (total_weight & 0xffffffff00000000ULL))
01491                                 rand |= cfs_rand() % (unsigned)total_weight;
01492                         else
01493                                 rand |= cfs_rand();
01494 
01495 #else
01496                         rand = ((__u64)cfs_rand() << 32 | cfs_rand()) %
01497                                 total_weight;
01498 #endif
01499                 } else {
01500                         rand = 0;
01501                 }
01502 
01503                 /* On average, this will hit larger-weighted OSTs more often.
01504                  * 0-weight OSTs will always get used last (only when rand=0) */
01505                 for (i = 0; i < osts->op_count; i++) {
01506                         __u32 idx = osts->op_array[i];
01507 
01508                         if (!cfs_bitmap_check(m->lod_ost_bitmap, idx))
01509                                 continue;
01510 
01511                         ost = OST_TGT(m,idx);
01512 
01513                         if (!ost->ltd_qos.ltq_usable)
01514                                 continue;
01515 
01516                         cur_weight += ost->ltd_qos.ltq_weight;
01517                         QOS_DEBUG("stripe_cnt=%d nfound=%d cur_weight="LPU64
01518                                   " rand="LPU64" total_weight="LPU64"\n",
01519                                   stripe_cnt, nfound, cur_weight, rand,
01520                                   total_weight);
01521 
01522                         if (cur_weight < rand)
01523                                 continue;
01524 
01525                         QOS_DEBUG("stripe=%d to idx=%d\n", nfound, idx);
01526 
01527                         /*
01528                          * do not put >1 objects on a single OST
01529                          */
01530                         if (lod_qos_is_ost_used(env, idx, nfound))
01531                                 continue;
01532                         lod_qos_ost_in_use(env, nfound, idx);
01533 
01534                         o = lod_qos_declare_object_on(env, m, idx, th);
01535                         if (IS_ERR(o)) {
01536                                 QOS_DEBUG("can't declare object on #%u: %d\n",
01537                                           idx, (int) PTR_ERR(o));
01538                                 continue;
01539                         }
01540                         stripe[nfound++] = o;
01541                         lod_qos_used(m, osts, idx, &total_weight);
01542                         rc = 0;
01543                         break;
01544                 }
01545 
01546                 if (rc) {
01547                         /* no OST found on this iteration, give up */
01548                         break;
01549                 }
01550         }
01551 
01552         if (unlikely(nfound != stripe_cnt)) {
01553                 /*
01554                  * when the decision to use weighted algorithm was made
01555                  * we had enough appropriate OSPs, but this state can
01556                  * change anytime (no space on OST, broken connection, etc)
01557                  * so it's possible OSP won't be able to provide us with
01558                  * an object due to just changed state
01559                  */
01560                 LCONSOLE_INFO("wanted %d, found %d\n", stripe_cnt, nfound);
01561                 for (i = 0; i < nfound; i++) {
01562                         LASSERT(stripe[i] != NULL);
01563                         lu_object_put(env, &stripe[i]->do_lu);
01564                         stripe[i] = NULL;
01565                 }
01566 
01567                 /* makes sense to rebalance next time */
01568                 m->lod_qos.lq_dirty = 1;
01569                 m->lod_qos.lq_same_space = 0;
01570 
01571                 rc = -EAGAIN;
01572         }
01573 
01574 out:
01575         up_write(&m->lod_qos.lq_rw_sem);
01576 
01577 out_nolock:
01578         if (pool != NULL) {
01579                 up_read(&pool_tgt_rw_sem(pool));
01580                 /* put back ref got by lod_find_pool() */
01581                 lod_pool_putref(pool);
01582         }
01583 
01584         RETURN(rc);
01585 }
01586 
01601 static __u16 lod_get_stripecnt(struct lod_device *lod, __u32 magic,
01602                                __u16 stripe_count)
01603 {
01604         __u32 max_stripes = LOV_MAX_STRIPE_COUNT_OLD;
01605 
01606         if (!stripe_count)
01607                 stripe_count = lod->lod_desc.ld_default_stripe_count;
01608         if (stripe_count > lod->lod_desc.ld_active_tgt_count)
01609                 stripe_count = lod->lod_desc.ld_active_tgt_count;
01610         if (!stripe_count)
01611                 stripe_count = 1;
01612 
01613         /* stripe count is based on whether OSD can handle larger EA sizes */
01614         if (lod->lod_osd_max_easize > 0)
01615                 max_stripes = lov_mds_md_max_stripe_count(
01616                         lod->lod_osd_max_easize, magic);
01617 
01618         return (stripe_count < max_stripes) ? stripe_count : max_stripes;
01619 }
01620 
01636 static int lod_use_defined_striping(const struct lu_env *env,
01637                                     struct lod_object *mo,
01638                                     const struct lu_buf *buf)
01639 {
01640         struct lov_mds_md_v1   *v1 = buf->lb_buf;
01641         struct lov_mds_md_v3   *v3 = buf->lb_buf;
01642         struct lov_ost_data_v1 *objs;
01643         __u32                   magic;
01644         int                     rc = 0;
01645         ENTRY;
01646 
01647         magic = le32_to_cpu(v1->lmm_magic);
01648         if (magic == LOV_MAGIC_V1_DEF) {
01649                 magic = LOV_MAGIC_V1;
01650                 objs = &v1->lmm_objects[0];
01651         } else if (magic == LOV_MAGIC_V3_DEF) {
01652                 magic = LOV_MAGIC_V3;
01653                 objs = &v3->lmm_objects[0];
01654                 lod_object_set_pool(mo, v3->lmm_pool_name);
01655         } else {
01656                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01657         }
01658 
01659         mo->ldo_pattern = le32_to_cpu(v1->lmm_pattern);
01660         mo->ldo_stripe_size = le32_to_cpu(v1->lmm_stripe_size);
01661         mo->ldo_stripenr = le16_to_cpu(v1->lmm_stripe_count);
01662         mo->ldo_layout_gen = le16_to_cpu(v1->lmm_layout_gen);
01663 
01664         /* fixup for released file before object initialization */
01665         if (mo->ldo_pattern & LOV_PATTERN_F_RELEASED) {
01666                 mo->ldo_released_stripenr = mo->ldo_stripenr;
01667                 mo->ldo_stripenr = 0;
01668         }
01669 
01670         LASSERT(buf->lb_len >= lov_mds_md_size(mo->ldo_stripenr, magic));
01671 
01672         if (mo->ldo_stripenr > 0)
01673                 rc = lod_initialize_objects(env, mo, objs);
01674 
01675 out:
01676         RETURN(rc);
01677 }
01678 
01696 static int lod_qos_parse_config(const struct lu_env *env,
01697                                 struct lod_object *lo,
01698                                 const struct lu_buf *buf)
01699 {
01700         struct lod_device     *d = lu2lod_dev(lod2lu_obj(lo)->lo_dev);
01701         struct lov_user_md_v1 *v1 = NULL;
01702         struct lov_user_md_v3 *v3 = NULL;
01703         char                  *pool_name = NULL;
01704         __u32                  magic;
01705         int                    rc;
01706         unsigned int           size;
01707         ENTRY;
01708 
01709         if (buf == NULL || buf->lb_buf == NULL || buf->lb_len == 0)
01710                 RETURN(0);
01711 
01712         v3 = buf->lb_buf;
01713         v1 = buf->lb_buf;
01714         magic = v1->lmm_magic;
01715 
01716         if (unlikely(magic == LOV_MAGIC_V1_DEF || magic == LOV_MAGIC_V3_DEF)) {
01717                 /* try to use as fully defined striping */
01718                 rc = lod_use_defined_striping(env, lo, buf);
01719                 RETURN(rc);
01720         }
01721 
01722         switch (magic) {
01723         case __swab32(LOV_USER_MAGIC_V1):
01724                 lustre_swab_lov_user_md_v1(v1);
01725                 magic = v1->lmm_magic;
01726                 /* fall through */
01727         case LOV_USER_MAGIC_V1:
01728                 size = sizeof(*v1);
01729                 break;
01730 
01731         case __swab32(LOV_USER_MAGIC_V3):
01732                 lustre_swab_lov_user_md_v3(v3);
01733                 magic = v3->lmm_magic;
01734                 /* fall through */
01735         case LOV_USER_MAGIC_V3:
01736                 size = sizeof(*v3);
01737                 pool_name = v3->lmm_pool_name;
01738                 break;
01739 
01740         case __swab32(LOV_USER_MAGIC_SPECIFIC):
01741                 lustre_swab_lov_user_md_v3(v3);
01742                 lustre_swab_lov_user_md_objects(v3->lmm_objects,
01743                                                 v3->lmm_stripe_count);
01744                 magic = v3->lmm_magic;
01745                 /* fall through */
01746         case LOV_USER_MAGIC_SPECIFIC:
01747                 if (v3->lmm_stripe_offset == LOV_OFFSET_DEFAULT)
01748                         v3->lmm_stripe_offset = v3->lmm_objects[0].l_ost_idx;
01749                 if (v3->lmm_pool_name[0] != '\0')
01750                         pool_name = v3->lmm_pool_name;
01751                 size = lov_user_md_size(v3->lmm_stripe_count,
01752                                         LOV_USER_MAGIC_SPECIFIC);
01753                 break;
01754 
01755         default:
01756                 CERROR("%s: unrecognized magic %X\n",
01757                        lod2obd(d)->obd_name, magic);
01758                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01759         }
01760 
01761         if (unlikely(buf->lb_len < size)) {
01762                 CERROR("%s: wrong size: %zd, expect: %u\n",
01763                        lod2obd(d)->obd_name, buf->lb_len, size);
01764                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01765         }
01766 
01767         lustre_print_user_md(D_OTHER, v1, "parse config");
01768 
01769         v1->lmm_magic = magic;
01770         if (v1->lmm_pattern == 0)
01771                 v1->lmm_pattern = LOV_PATTERN_RAID0;
01772         if (lov_pattern(v1->lmm_pattern) != LOV_PATTERN_RAID0) {
01773                 CERROR("%s: invalid pattern: %x\n",
01774                        lod2obd(d)->obd_name, v1->lmm_pattern);
01775                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01776         }
01777         lo->ldo_pattern = v1->lmm_pattern;
01778 
01779         if (v1->lmm_stripe_size > 0)
01780                 lo->ldo_stripe_size = v1->lmm_stripe_size;
01781 
01782         if (lo->ldo_stripe_size & (LOV_MIN_STRIPE_SIZE - 1))
01783                 lo->ldo_stripe_size = LOV_MIN_STRIPE_SIZE;
01784 
01785         if (v1->lmm_stripe_count > 0)
01786                 lo->ldo_stripenr = v1->lmm_stripe_count;
01787 
01788         lo->ldo_def_stripe_offset = v1->lmm_stripe_offset;
01789 
01790         lod_object_set_pool(lo, NULL);
01791         if (pool_name != NULL) {
01792                 struct pool_desc *pool;
01793 
01794                 /* In the function below, .hs_keycmp resolves to
01795                  * pool_hashkey_keycmp() */
01796                 /* coverity[overrun-buffer-val] */
01797                 pool = lod_find_pool(d, pool_name);
01798                 if (pool != NULL) {
01799                         if (lo->ldo_def_stripe_offset != LOV_OFFSET_DEFAULT) {
01800                                 rc = lod_check_index_in_pool(
01801                                                lo->ldo_def_stripe_offset, pool);
01802                                 if (rc < 0) {
01803                                         lod_pool_putref(pool);
01804                                         CERROR("%s: invalid offset, %u\n",
01805                                                lod2obd(d)->obd_name,
01806                                                lo->ldo_def_stripe_offset);
01807                                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01808                                 }
01809                         }
01810 
01811                         if (lo->ldo_stripenr > pool_tgt_count(pool))
01812                                 lo->ldo_stripenr = pool_tgt_count(pool);
01813 
01814                         lod_pool_putref(pool);
01815                 }
01816 
01817                 lod_object_set_pool(lo, pool_name);
01818         }
01819 
01820         /* fixup for released file */
01821         if (lo->ldo_pattern & LOV_PATTERN_F_RELEASED) {
01822                 lo->ldo_released_stripenr = lo->ldo_stripenr;
01823                 lo->ldo_stripenr = 0;
01824         }
01825 
01826         RETURN(0);
01827 }
01828 
01848 int lod_qos_prep_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct lod_object *lo,
01849                         struct lu_attr *attr, const struct lu_buf *buf,
01850                         struct thandle *th)
01851 {
01852         struct lod_device      *d = lu2lod_dev(lod2lu_obj(lo)->lo_dev);
01853         struct dt_object      **stripe;
01854         int                     stripe_len;
01855         int                     flag = LOV_USES_ASSIGNED_STRIPE;
01856         int                     i, rc;
01857         ENTRY;
01858 
01859         LASSERT(lo);
01860 
01861         /* no OST available */
01862         /* XXX: should we be waiting a bit to prevent failures during
01863          * cluster initialization? */
01864         if (d->lod_ostnr == 0)
01865                 GOTO(out, rc = -EIO);
01866 
01867         /*
01868          * by this time, the object's ldo_stripenr and ldo_stripe_size
01869          * contain default value for striping: taken from the parent
01870          * or from filesystem defaults
01871          *
01872          * in case the caller is passing lovea with new striping config,
01873          * we may need to parse lovea and apply new configuration
01874          */
01875         rc = lod_qos_parse_config(env, lo, buf);
01876         if (rc)
01877                 GOTO(out, rc);
01878 
01879         /* A released file is being created */
01880         if (lo->ldo_stripenr == 0)
01881                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01882 
01883         if (likely(lo->ldo_stripe == NULL)) {
01884                 struct lov_user_md *lum = NULL;
01885 
01886                 /*
01887                  * no striping has been created so far
01888                  */
01889                 LASSERT(lo->ldo_stripenr > 0);
01890                 /*
01891                  * statfs and check OST targets now, since ld_active_tgt_count
01892                  * could be changed if some OSTs are [de]activated manually.
01893                  */
01894                 lod_qos_statfs_update(env, d);
01895                 lo->ldo_stripenr = lod_get_stripecnt(d, LOV_MAGIC,
01896                                                      lo->ldo_stripenr);
01897 
01898                 stripe_len = lo->ldo_stripenr;
01899                 OBD_ALLOC(stripe, sizeof(stripe[0]) * stripe_len);
01900                 if (stripe == NULL)
01901                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01902 
01903                 lod_getref(&d->lod_ost_descs);
01904                 /* XXX: support for non-0 files w/o objects */
01905                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "tgt_count %d stripenr %d\n",
01906                                 d->lod_desc.ld_tgt_count, stripe_len);
01907 
01908                 if (buf != NULL && buf->lb_buf != NULL)
01909                         lum = buf->lb_buf;
01910 
01911                 if (lum != NULL && lum->lmm_magic == LOV_USER_MAGIC_SPECIFIC) {
01912                         rc = lod_alloc_ost_list(env, lo, stripe, lum, th);
01913                 } else if (lo->ldo_def_stripe_offset == LOV_OFFSET_DEFAULT) {
01914                         rc = lod_alloc_qos(env, lo, stripe, flag, th);
01915                         if (rc == -EAGAIN)
01916                                 rc = lod_alloc_rr(env, lo, stripe, flag, th);
01917                 } else {
01918                         rc = lod_alloc_specific(env, lo, stripe, flag, th);
01919                 }
01920                 lod_putref(d, &d->lod_ost_descs);
01921 
01922                 if (rc < 0) {
01923                         for (i = 0; i < stripe_len; i++)
01924                                 if (stripe[i] != NULL)
01925                                         lu_object_put(env, &stripe[i]->do_lu);
01926 
01927                         OBD_FREE(stripe, sizeof(stripe[0]) * stripe_len);
01928                         lo->ldo_stripenr = 0;
01929                 } else {
01930                         lo->ldo_stripe = stripe;
01931                         lo->ldo_stripes_allocated = stripe_len;
01932                 }
01933         } else {
01934                 /*
01935                  * lod_qos_parse_config() found supplied buf as a predefined
01936                  * striping (not a hint), so it allocated all the object
01937                  * now we need to create them
01938                  */
01939                 for (i = 0; i < lo->ldo_stripenr; i++) {
01940                         struct dt_object  *o;
01941 
01942                         o = lo->ldo_stripe[i];
01943                         LASSERT(o);
01944 
01945                         rc = lod_sub_object_declare_create(env, o, attr, NULL,
01946                                                            NULL, th);
01947                         if (rc < 0) {
01948                                 CERROR("can't declare create: %d\n", rc);
01949                                 break;
01950                         }
01951                 }
01952         }
01953 
01954 out:
01955         RETURN(rc);
01956 }
